Content-Type: text/plain;
 charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Jeff,
 
Would you be able to post the flame operating conditions and/or the 
driver routine (python or  matlab) which is stalling at 20 to 30 grid
points
to the mailing list.  
 
I just successfully ran the mechanism you posted on the H2-O2
stagnation flame demo ("stflame.py") 
and the  burner-stabilized methane flame demo ("flame2.py").   I don't
necessarily
think there is a problem with the mechanism for flame calculations. 
The property
discontinuities, however could cause some problems with reactor
networks in iterating for
the temperature from the gas composition (mass fractions) and the
internal energy.
 
I would tend to think that the cause of the non-convergence is with
solver
settings or maybe the initial conditions.    I have found (for premixed
flames) that the solution 
is sensitive to both the initial grid (both resolution and extent) and
the timestep used.   
 
You might also try modifying the initialization function ( "f.init()"
in python ).  This
sets an approximate piecewise linear initial condition for all the
variables.  The control nodes 
for the stagnation flame are at the end points and at 30% and 70% of
the grid extent (in python).   The 
consequence is that if you change the physical size of the grid you
also change the initial flame structure.
 
I have found (in premixed flames) that moving these control points can
be more effective
than increasing the grid resolution or modifying the grid
distribution.
 
Dave H.

>>> jeffb@... 12/8/2005 6:15 PM >>>

Dear Cantera users,

I have been attempting to utilize the Konnov mechanism for the
simulation of stagnation point flames.  So far, I have been
unsuccessful
at getting the solution to converge past 20-30 grid points.  When
converting the mechanism, I had to declare several of the reactions as
duplicates that Cantera flagged as errors.

Thanks to Bhupinder for sending out a cti of this mechanism.  I tried
it
out and it failed to load into Cantera due to these undeclared
duplicate
reactions.  Is this a problem that only I have faced, or did you also
find this error Bhupinder and Mateusz?

I have attached the cti file that I had previously created for people
to
try out.  I would appreciate feedback on others success or failure
with
this mechanism.  If another user has their own cti of the Konnov
mechanism that they have utilized successfully, could you please send
it
to the Cantera list, or myself?

Thanks,

Jeffrey M. Bergthorson
Postdoctoral Scholar in Aeronautics
California Institute of Technology
Pasadena, CA, 91106
626.395.4445 (phone)
jeffb@...

-----Original Message-----
From: cantera@yahoogroups.com [mailto:cantera@yahoogroups.com] On
Behalf
Of Bhupinder Singh
Sent: Saturday, December 03, 2005 12:14 AM
To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [cantera] konnov mechnism loading

Hi,

I ran into this problem a few months back..I believe its a software
problem..the latest version of cantera / python does convert the files
when the transport file is included

I've converted the Konnov mechanism files for you and attached it..

Good luck with everything.

Bhupinder

On Wed Nov 30 12:29:04 EST 2005, mateusz_zb <mateusz_zb@...>
wrote:

> Dear Friends I have a little problem with loading konnov mechanism. 
> When I call out m-file ck2cti  (f = ck2cti ('konmech.inp', 
> 'kontherm.dat', 'kontransport.dat')) in matlab nothing is happening.

> File .cti is 0 KB and in the file "ck2cti.log" everything is correct

> and at the end the massage is
> displayed: "Success... elapsed CPU time = 2.391 s". Matlab is all the

> time "Busy" and does not working.
> Very interesting is that, when I call out m-file ck2cti (f = ck2cti 
> ('konmechcd.inp', 'konthermcd.dat')) without file transport.dat 
> everything is ok and cti file appear but of course without transport

> properties. All files konmech.inp, therm.dat and transport.dat are 
> from:
>
http://homepages.vub.ac.be/~akonnov/science/mechanism/version0_5.html
> 
> Please help me!!! Maybe somebody have konnov mechanism in cti file?
If

> it is no problem, please send it to me (mateusz_zb@... and 
> mateuszzb@...) Many thanks in advance for help
> 
> Mateusz
